com.android.ex.carousel

Class CarouselController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.android.ex.carousel.CarouselController

  • public class CarouselController
extends java.lang.Object

    This class represents the basic building block for using a 3D Carousel. The Carousel is basically a scene of cards and slots. The spacing between cards is dictated by the number of slots and the radius. The number of visible cards dictates how far the Carousel can be moved. If the number of cards exceeds the number of slots, then the Carousel will continue to go around until the last card can be seen.

      Whether to write to the depth buffer when rendering.

      • STORE_CONFIG_ALPHA

        public static final int STORE_CONFIG_ALPHA

        See Also:

      • STORE_CONFIG_DEPTH_READS

        public static final int STORE_CONFIG_DEPTH_READS
        Whether to read from the depth buffer when rendering. Determines with glDepthFunc() is given GL_LESS or GL_ALWAYS. On for GL_LESS, off for GL_ALWAYS.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STORE_CONFIG_DEPTH_WRITES

        public static final int STORE_CONFIG_DEPTH_WRITES
        Whether to write to the depth buffer when rendering. Passed to glDepthMask().
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setSlotCount

        public void setSlotCount(int n)
        Set the number of slots around the Carousel. Basically equivalent to the poles horses might attach to on a real Carousel.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of slots

      • setVisibleSlots

        public void setVisibleSlots(int n)
        Sets the number of visible slots around the Carousel. This is primarily used as a cheap form of clipping. The Carousel will never show more than this many cards.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of visible slots

      • setVisibleDetails

        public void setVisibleDetails(int n)
        Set the number of detail textures that can be visible at one time.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of slots

      • setPrefetchCardCount

        public void setPrefetchCardCount(int n)
        Set the number of cards to pre-load that are outside of the visible region, as determined by setVisibleSlots(). This number gets added to the number of visible slots and used to determine when resources for cards should be loaded. This number should be small (n <= 4) for systems with limited texture memory or views that show more than half dozen cards in the view.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of cards; should be even, so the count is the same on each side

      • setRowCount

        public void setRowCount(int n)
        Sets the number of rows of cards to show in each slot.

      • setRowSpacing

        public void setRowSpacing(float s)
        Sets the spacing between each row of cards when rowCount > 1.

      • setFirstCardTop

        public void setFirstCardTop(boolean f)
        Sets the position of the first card when rowCount > 1 .

      • setOverscrollSlots

        public void setOverscrollSlots(float slots)
        Sets the amount of allowed overscroll (in slots)

      • setDetailTextureAlignment

        public void setDetailTextureAlignment(int alignment)
        Sets how detail textures are aligned with respect to the card.
        Parameters:
        alignment - a bitmask of DetailAlignment flags.

      • setForceBlendCardsWithZ

        public void setForceBlendCardsWithZ(boolean enabled)
        Set whether depth is enabled while blending. Generally, this is discouraged because it causes bad artifacts. Careful attention to geometry and alpha transparency of textures can mitigate much of this. Geometry for an individual item must be drawn back-to-front, for example.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable depth while blending, and false to disable it.

      • setDrawRuler

        public void setDrawRuler(boolean drawRuler)
        Set whether to draw a ruler from the card to the detail texture
        Parameters:
        drawRuler - True to draw a ruler, false to draw nothing where the ruler would go.

      • createCards

        public void createCards(int n)
        This dictates how many cards are in the deck. If the number of cards is greater than the number of slots, then the Carousel goes around n / slot_count times. Can be called again to increase or decrease the number of cards.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of cards to create.

      • getCardCount

        public int getCardCount()

      • setTextureForItem

        public void setTextureForItem(int n,
                              android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This sets the texture on card n. It should only be called in response to CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int). Since there's no guarantee that a given texture is still on the screen, replacing this texture should be done by first setting it to null and then waiting for the next CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int) to swap it with the new one.
        Parameters:
        n - the card given by CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int)
        bitmap - the bitmap image to show

      • setDetailTextureForItem

        public void setDetailTextureForItem(int n,
                                    float offx,
                                    float offy,
                                    float loffx,
                                    float loffy,
                                    android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This sets the detail texture that floats above card n. It should only be called in response to CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestDetailTexture(int). Since there's no guarantee that a given texture is still on the screen, replacing this texture should be done by first setting it to null and then waiting for the next CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestDetailTexture(int) to swap it with the new one.
        Parameters:
        n - the card to set detail texture for
        offx - an optional offset to apply to the texture (in pixels) from top of detail line
        offy - an optional offset to apply to the texture (in pixels) from top of detail line
        loffx - an optional offset to apply to the line (in pixels) from left edge of card
        loffy - an optional offset to apply to the line (in pixels) from top of screen
        bitmap - the bitmap to show as the detail

      • invalidateTexture

        public void invalidateTexture(int n,
                              boolean eraseCurrent)
        Sets the specified texture as invalid. If eraseCurrent is true, the texture will be immediately cleared from view and an invalidate handler will be called. If eraseCurrent is false, a replacement texture will be requested, and the old texture will be left in place in the meantime.
        Parameters:
        n - the card to invalidate the detail texture for
        eraseCurrent - whether to erase the current texture

      • invalidateDetailTexture

        public void invalidateDetailTexture(int n,
                                    boolean eraseCurrent)
        Sets the specified detail texture as invalid. If eraseCurrent is true, the texture will be immediately cleared from view and an invalidate handler will be called. If eraseCurrent is false, a replacement texture will be requested, and the old texture will be left in place in the meantime.
        Parameters:
        n - the card to invalidate the detail texture for
        eraseCurrent - whether to erase the current texture

      • setDefaultBitmap

        public void setDefaultBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets the bitmap to show on a card when the card draws the very first time. Generally, this bitmap will only be seen during the first few frames of startup or when the number of cards are changed. It can be ignored in most cases, as the cards will generally only be in the loading or loaded state.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setLoadingBitmap

        public void setLoadingBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets the bitmap to show on the card while the texture is loading. It is set to this value just before CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int) is called and changed when CarouselView.setTextureForItem(int, Bitmap) is called. It is shared by all cards.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(float red,
                               float green,
                               float blue,
                               float alpha)
        Sets background to specified color. If a background texture is specified with CarouselView.setBackgroundBitmap(Bitmap), then this call has no effect.
        Parameters:
        red - the amount of red
        green - the amount of green
        blue - the amount of blue
        alpha - the amount of alpha

      • setBackgroundBitmap

        public void setBackgroundBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Can be used to optionally set the background to a bitmap. When set to something other than null, this overrides CarouselController#setBackgroundColor(Float4).
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setDetailLoadingBitmap

        public void setDetailLoadingBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Can be used to optionally set a "loading" detail bitmap. Typically, this is just a black texture with alpha = 0 to allow details to slowly fade in.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setDetailLineBitmap

        public void setDetailLineBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This texture is used to draw a line from the card alongside the texture detail. The line will be as wide as the texture. It can be used to give the line glow effects as well as allowing other blending effects. It is typically one dimensional, e.g. 3x1.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setDefaultGeometry

        public void setDefaultGeometry(int resId)
        This geometry will be shown when no geometry has been loaded for a given slot. If not set, a quad will be drawn in its place. It is shared for all cards. If something other than simple planar geometry is used, consider enabling depth test with setForceBlendCardsWithZ(boolean)
        Parameters:
        mesh -

      • setDefaultCardMatrix

        public void setDefaultCardMatrix(float[] matrix)
        Sets the matrix used to transform card geometries. By default, this is the identity matrix, but you can specify a different matrix if you want to scale, translate and / or rotate the card before drawing.
        Parameters:
        matrix - array of 9 or 16 floats representing a 3x3 or 4x4 matrix, or null as a shortcut for an identity matrix.

      • setLoadingGeometry

        public void setLoadingGeometry(int resId)
        This is an intermediate version of the object to show while geometry is loading. If not set, a quad will be drawn in its place. It is shared for all cards. If something other than simple planar geometry is used, consider enabling depth test with CarouselView.setForceBlendCardsWithZ(boolean)
        Parameters:
        resId -

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(CarouselRS.CarouselCallback callback)
        Sets the callback for receiving events from RenderScript.
        Parameters:
        callback -

      • getCallback

        public CarouselRS.CarouselCallback getCallback()
        Gets the callback for receiving events from Renderscript.

      • setStartAngle

        public void setStartAngle(float angle)
        Sets the startAngle for the Carousel. The start angle is the first position of the first slot draw. Cards will be drawn from this angle in a counter-clockwise manner around the Carousel.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle, in radians.

      • setCarouselRotationAngle

        public void setCarouselRotationAngle(float angle)
        Set the current carousel rotation angle, in card units. This is measured in card positions, not in radians or degrees. A value of 0.0 means that card 0 is in the home position. A value of 1.0 means that card 1 is in the home position, and so on. The maximum value will be somewhat less than the total number of cards.
        Parameters:
        angle -

      • setCarouselRotationAngle

        public void setCarouselRotationAngle(float endAngle,
                                     int milliseconds,
                                     int interpolationMode,
                                     float maxAnimatedArc)
        Triggers a rotation of the carousel. All angles are in card units, see: setCarouselRotationAngle(float)) for more details.
        Parameters:
        endAngle - the card unit to which the carousel should rotate to
        milliseconds - the length of the animation
        interpolationMode - three modes are currently supported : CarouselView.InterpolationMode.LINEAR CarouselView.InterpolationMode.DECELERATE_QUADRATIC CarouselView.InterpolationMode.ACCELERATE_DECELERATE_CUBIC
        maxAnimatedArc - the maximum angular distance over which the transition will be animated. If the current position is further away, it is set at maxAnimatedArc from endAngle. This parameter is ignored when <= 0.

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(float radius)

      • setDragModel

        public void setDragModel(int model)
        Sets the current model for dragging. There are currently four drag models: CarouselView.DRAG_MODEL_SCREEN_DELTA CarouselView.DRAG_MODEL_PLANE CarouselView.DRAG_MODEL_CYLINDER_INSIDE CarouselView.DRAG_MODEL_CYLINDER_OUTSIDE
        Parameters:
        model -

      • setFillDirection

        public void setFillDirection(int direction)
        Sets the direction to fill in cards around the carousel.
        Parameters:
        direction - Either CarouselRS.FILL_DIRECTION_CCW or CarouselRS.FILL_DIRECTION_CW.

      • setCardRotation

        public void setCardRotation(float cardRotation)

      • setCardsFaceTangent

        public void setCardsFaceTangent(boolean faceTangent)

      • setSwaySensitivity

        public void setSwaySensitivity(float swaySensitivity)

      • setFrictionCoefficient

        public void setFrictionCoefficient(float frictionCoefficient)

      • setDragFactor

        public void setDragFactor(float dragFactor)

      • setLookAt

        public void setLookAt(float[] eye,
                      float[] at,
                      float[] up)

      • setRezInCardCount

        public void setRezInCardCount(float n)
        This sets the number of cards in the distance that will be shown "rezzing in". These alpha values will be faded in from the background to the foreground over 'n' cards. A floating point value is used to allow subtly changing the rezzing in position.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of cards to rez in.

      • setFadeInDuration

        public void setFadeInDuration(long t)
        This sets the duration (in ms) that a card takes to fade in when loaded via a call to CarouselView.setTextureForItem(int, Bitmap). The timer starts the moment CarouselView.setTextureForItem(int, Bitmap) is called and continues until all of the cards have faded in. Note: using large values will extend the animation until all cards have faded in.
        Parameters:
        t - The time, in milliseconds

      • setCardCreationFadeDuration

        public void setCardCreationFadeDuration(long t)
        This sets the duration (in ms) that a card takes to fade in when it is initially created, such as when it is added or when the application starts. The timer starts at the moment when the card is first created. Replacing a card's contents does not affect the timer.
        Parameters:
        t - The time, in milliseconds

      • onTouchStarted

        public void onTouchStarted(float x,
                           float y,
                           long t)
        Tells the carousel that a touch event has started at the designated location.
        Parameters:
        x - The number of pixels from the left edge that the event occurred
        y - The number of pixels from the top edge that the event occurred
        t - The time stamp of the event

      • onTouchMoved

        public void onTouchMoved(float x,
                         float y,
                         long t)
        Tells the carousel that a touch event has moved to the designated location.
        Parameters:
        x - The number of pixels from the left edge that the event occurred
        y - The number of pixels from the top edge that the event occurred
        t - The time stamp of the event

      • onLongPress

        public void onLongPress()
        Tells the carousel that the user has long-pressed.

      • onTouchStopped

        public void onTouchStopped(float x,
                           float y,
                           long t)
        Tells the carousel that a touch event has stopped at the designated location.
        Parameters:
        x - The number of pixels from the left edge that the event occurred
        y - The number of pixels from the top edge that the event occurred
        t - The time stamp of the event

      • setStoreConfigs

        public void setStoreConfigs(int[] configs)
        Set the StoreConfig parameters that will be used for each mesh primitive. Each integer in the array is a bitfield composed of STORE_CONFIG_ALPHA, STORE_CONFIG_DEPTH_READS, and STORE_CONFIG_DEPTH_WRITES. These parameters MUST correspond to primitives in geometry previously set in setDefaultGeometry(int) or setLoadingGeometry(int) or setGeometryForItem(int,Mesh).
        Parameters:
        configs - An array, each element of which corresponds to an ordered mesh primitive
